column1: Leah Streeper, Michael Kimpflen, Sara Lupino
Born in Concord, North Carolina.to Parker D. and Flonnie Kiser. She was the fifth of
1942 9 The Kiser family moves to Burlington, North Carolina
1953 21 Daughter, Vanessa Dale Taylor, is born in Alamance County, North Carolina
1954 21 Began working as clerk at Kroger
1956 23 Blanche’s father, Parker, abandons the family to find a younger woman
1959 26 Daughter, Cynthia Dawn Taylor, is born in Alamance County, North Carolina.
1959 26 Blanche’s mother, Flonnie, files for divorce from her husband, Parker
1959 26 Blanche is promoted to head cashier at Kroger
1960 27 Blanche reconciles relationship with father, Parker, by going to see him
09/18/1966 33 Blanche’s father, Parker,  dies with symptoms of arsenic poisoning at the age of 62
Isla Taylor (WF, 83), James Taylor’s mother, dies in similar way that Blanche’s father
1971 38 Raymond Reid, assistant manager of Kroger have open affair.
9/1973 40 James Taylor starts to show flu-like symptoms
1973 40 Blanche moves to Burlington, North Carolina
1/1985 52 Blanche’s house in Burlington burns down
Blanche bought a trailer home with the insurance money she received from the house
Blanche received a $275,000 settlement from Kroger as part of a sexual harassment

column3: Raymond Reid is admitted to the hospital and doctors initially diagnose him assuffering from shingles.
Raymond Reid (WM, 50) dies in a Winston-Salem hospital. Doctors list the cause ofdeath as Gullain-Barre syndrome. It is later discovered that Reid died from arsenicpoisoning.
Test results positive for arsenic in Dwight Moore

Investigation into the poisoning of Dwight Moore began and the bodies of ParkerKiser, James Taylor, Isla Taylor, and Raymond Reid are exhumed to test for arsenic.All four were found with elevated levels of arsenic.
Blanche is arrested and charged with assault for attempting to kill Reverend DwightMoore. Charges for the murder of Raymond Reid are later added.
Blanche’s trial begins for the murder of Raymond Reid
Jury finds Blanche guilty of murder in the first degree
The judge agrees with the jury and sentences Blanche to death.
A book, Preacher’s Girl, and a television movie, The Black Widow Murders, aboutBlanche Moore are released
Still alive and in prison as of November 18, 2012
